Pre-Game Insights: Toronto Raptors are on a five-game losing streak and will try to break it when they play against the Detroit Pistons.
The Raptors are 1-3 in Eastern Conference games and 1-3 in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
The Pistons are 4-7 against conference opponents and are second in the Eastern Conference with 35.3 defensive rebounds per game, led by Tobias Harris averaging 6.6.
The Raptors average 112.8 points per game, 1.0 more point than the 111.8 the Pistons allow.
The Pistons are shooting 46.5% from the field, 1.3% lower than the 47.8% the Raptors' opponents have shot this season.
Jakob Poeltl is averaging 13.9 points and 11.1 rebounds for the Raptors.
Cade Cunningham is scoring 23.8 points per game and averaging 7.2 rebounds for the Pistons.
Others: In the last 10 games, the Raptors have a record of 1-9, averaging 113.2 points, 44.4 rebounds, 29.7 assists, 8.2 steals, and 4.2 blocks per game while shooting 46.2% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 120.6 points per game.

In the last 10 games, the Pistons have a record of 5-5, averaging 109.3 points, 48.1 rebounds, 25.0 assists, 5.4 steals, and 6.0 blocks per game while shooting 46.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 110.2 points.
Injuries for the Raptors include Kelly Olynyk (out, back), Bruce Brown (out, knee), Immanuel Quickley (day to day, elbow), Ja'Kobe Walter (out, shoulder), and Scottie Barnes (out, eye).

Injuries for the Pistons include Jaden Ivey (day to day, toe), Bobi Klintman (out, calf), Simone Fontecchio (day to day, toe), Tim Hardaway Jr. (day to day, head), and Ausar Thompson (day to day, illness).
